intro: Acronychia goniocarpa, commonly known as the broad-leafed acronychia, is a small to medium-sized tree native to northern Australia. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its rough, fissured bark and elliptical to ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by spherical, woody fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in coastal or lowland areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
